1:
My son, keep my words\q and store up my commands within yourself.
\q
2:
Keep my commands and live\q and keep my instruction as the apple of your eye.
\q
3:
Tie them on your fingers;\q write them on the tablet of your heart.


\q
4:
Say to wisdom, "You are my sister,"\q and call understanding your kinsman,
\q
5:
in order to keep yourself from the adulterous woman,\q from the immoral woman with her smooth words.


\q
6:
At the window of my house\q I was looking out through the lattice.
\q
7:
I looked at the naive people,\q and I noticed among the young men
\q a youth who had no sense.


\q
8:
That young man passed down the street near her corner,\q and he went toward her house.
\q
9:
It was twilight, in the evening of the day,\q at the time of night and darkness.


\q
10:
There a woman met him,\q dressed like a prostitute, with a false heart.
\q
11:
She was loud and wayward;\q her feet did not stay at home.
\q
12:
Now in the streets, then in the market place,\q and at every corner she waited in ambush.

\q
13:
So she grabbed him and kissed him,\q with a strong face she said to him,
\q
14:
"I made my peace offering today,\q I paid my vows,
\q
15:
so came I out to meet you,\q to eagerly seek your face, and I have found you.


\q
16:
I have spread coverings on my bed,\q colored linens from Egypt.
\q
17:
I have sprinkled my bed\q with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
\q
18:
Come, let us drink our fill of love until morning;\q let us take great pleasure in acts of love.


\q
19:
For my husband is not at his house;\q he has gone on a long journey.
\q
20:
He took a bag of money with him;\q he will return on the day of the full moon."
\q
21:
With much talk she turned him;\q with her smooth lips she misled him.


\q
22:
He went after her suddenly\q like an ox going to slaughter,
\q like a deer caught in a trap,  \f + \fqa Deer\fqa* \ft could be a stag or an antelope. The Vulgate has: \fqa lamb\fqa*. The LXX has: \fqa like a dog to the muzzle.\f*
\q
23:
until an arrow pierces through its liver.\q He was like a bird rushing into a snare.
\q He did not know that it would cost his life.

\q
24:
Now, my sons, listen to me;\q pay attention to the words of my mouth.
\q
25:
May your heart not turn aside onto her paths;\q do not be led astray onto her paths.


\q
26:
She has caused many people to fall down pierced;\q her dead victims are very many.
\q
27: Her house is on the paths to Sheol;\q they go down to the dark bedrooms of death.
